alert.note: Alert for Orange; Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 9:46PM PST until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1142 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Orange, Riverside and San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 1142 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Rockslides along mountain highways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 946 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anaheim, Santa Ana, Riverside, Irvine, San Bernardino, Fontana, Huntington Beach, Garden Grove, Ontario and western Corona. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
